description.purpose: Step detection parameters optimized for different sensor locations

parameter_tuning.ankle: Sensors at ankle level - clearer step signals, lower noise
parameter_tuning.wrist: Sensors at wrist level - more arm swing artifacts, higher noise
parameter_tuning.back: Sensors at back/sacrum - whole body movement, moderate noise

ankle_optimization.reason: Ankle sensors provide clearest step signals with lower noise
adjustments: Smaller window sizes for better temporal resolution
Shorter min_time_between_steps for faster walking detection

wrist_optimization.reason: Wrist sensors have more artifacts from arm swing and daily activities
adjustments: Larger window sizes to smooth out noise
Higher thresholds to reduce false positives from arm movements

back_optimization.reason: Back/sacrum sensors capture whole-body movement patterns
adjustments: Medium window sizes for balance of noise reduction and response
Standard timing parameters for natural gait
